entry.title: S/4HANA 2025 FPS0 Fully-Activated Appliance custom installation
entry.content:
THIS IS A DUPLICATE BLOG CREATED BY SYSTEM AND WILL BE DELETED ! PLEASE USE THE CORRECT LINK AS BELOW ALTHOUGH IT IS SAME CONTENT !
https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/s-4hana-2025-fps0-fully-activated-appliance-custom-installation/ba-p/14288318

This blog covers installation of (1) SAP S/4HANA server and (2) SAP NW JAVA / ADS server as shown in the graphic below. The installation is based on file restore and is different from the standard installs using SWPM.

Please refer to S/4HANA SQUARE ONE for other blogs

In this blog the procedure is simplified for hostname change and SID change. Also if you want to change instance number the command, screens show where you can change the instance number. This would make sense if your network cannot accommodate the unique hostname and SID. Also if it is a more permanent installation you may like to change SID and hostname.

If you want to do standard installation with no change in hostname and sid please refer to other blog In this blog the procedure is simplified for standard installation with NO HOSTNAME OR SID CHANGE. The advantage with this is that you don't have to do many of the steps related to SID change and it does make sense if you will be installing the instance temporarily.

This blog is based on a fresh installation of SUSE Linux for SAP OS without having any previous SAP instances created and deleted. I did not have to pre install hostagent, etc. There are mount points/links to be setup as shown in the right place in the directory structure. The steps in the guides provided with SAP Note 2041140 could be used as a reference in case there are issues specific to your environment. Just follow the steps below to install both systems shown in red square below:

Please find below the main note for ordering the appliance:
2041140 - Order an SAP pre-assembled Best Practices software appliance (as partner or customer)

PART1: SOFTWARE DOWNLOAD

Please download the software media from https://me.sap.com/softwarecenter
INSTALLATIONS & UPGRADES => By Alphabetical Index (A-Z) => S => SAP S/4HANA => SAP S/4HANA 2025 => S/4HANA FULLY-ACTIVATED APPLIANCE => SAP S/4HANA 2025 FA APPL

On SAP S/4HANA Server, download the 51059242_1 to 51059242_5  files and SWPM20SP22_5-80003424.SAR (or later).

On SAP NW JAVA / ADS server, download the 51059242_5, SWPM10SP45_4-20009701.SAR and 51050829_JAVA_part 1 & 2 - NW 7.5 Java based SW Comp.

PART2: INSTALL SAP S/4HANA

STEP 1: PREPARE SYSTEM Prepare Linux Server as below for the appliance. The values in Used column below show the minimum size needed. For /sapmnt provide min 30GB, /hana/data space - min 500GB, /hana/log min 120GB. I have used /sapmedia - 200GB temporary separate mount that can be removed later.

Plan the change of SID, hostname, instance number. Please refer to the notes below for reserved SIDs SAP Note 1979280 - Reserved SAP System Identifiers (SAPSID) with Software Provisioning Manager and hostnames SAP Note 611361 - Hostnames of SAP ABAP Platform servers
The table below shows standard SID and hostnames and what we are changing it to.

The /etc/hostname and /etc/host file is below. If you are changing hostname for db and sap add the standard and new hostname for DB but for SAP only provide new hostname. Also for J2E include the new hostname only as this is on separate instance. The standard hostname can be removed later as shown in the steps below. Please note that it has

STEP 2: EXTRACT FILES Extract files 51059242_*  in /sapmedia

sid-hdb-s4d:/sapmedia# unzip 51059242_1.ZIP
sid-hdb-s4d:/sapmedia# unzip 51059242_2.ZIP
sid-hdb-s4d:/sapmedia# unzip 51059242_3.ZIP
sid-hdb-s4d:/sapmedia# unzip 51059242_4.ZIP
sid-hdb-s4d:/sapmedia# unzip 51059242_5.ZIP

Allow approx 2 hours for extraction.

We will install Central system with DB and App on same server. Please move all *.tgz-* files (from 51059242_1 to 51059242_4) to /sapmedia/51059242_1/SAPS4HANA2025SAPHANADB20_1

cd /sapmedia/51059242_1/SAPS4HANA2025SAPHANADB20_1
mv /sapmedia/51059242_2/SAPS4HANA2025SAPHANADB20_2/*.tgz-*   .
mv /sapmedia/51059242_3/SAPS4HANA2025SAPHANADB20_3/*.tgz-*   .
mv /sapmedia/51059242_4/SAPS4HANA2025SAPHANADB20_4/*.tgz-*   .
mv /sapmedia/51059242_5/SAPS4HANA2025SAPHANADB20_5/*.tgz-*   .

In the next step we will extract the above *.tgz files but please note the directories size is as follows so you can provide ample space:

Please use command below to extract the database related archives:

sid-hdb-s4d:/sapmedia/# cd 51059242_1/SAPS4HANA2025SAPHANADB20_1

cat dblog.tgz-* | tar --numeric-owner -zpxvf - -C /

Similarly extract the remaining files:

cat dbexe.tgz-* | tar --numeric-owner -zpxvf - -C /
cat dbdata.tgz-* | tar --numeric-owner -zpxvf - -C /

It takes about an hour for extraction.

Below two Application related archives may be extracted on a separate app server for distributed installation. These files will be extracted under /sapmnt/S4H and /usr/sap/S4H so if you are changing the SID, then you will have to first extract to SID-S4H and then create links to your own SID like S4D

Then extract the files:
sid-hdd-s4d:/usr/sap #cd 51059242_1/SAPS4HANA2025SAPHANADB20_1
cat usrsap_s4h.tgz-* | tar --numeric-owner  -zpxvf - -C /
cat sapmnt_s4h.tgz-* | tar --numeric-owner  -zpxvf - -C /

STEP 3: GET PASSWORDS Download the file below and open the file in Internet Explorer to note passwords:
/sapmedia/51059242_1/SAPS4HANA2025SAPHANADB20_5/SAP_Software_Appliance.xml


Follow this procedure as it is a known issue, please refer SAP Note 2082466 - Known Issues in SAP HANA Platform Lifecycle Management (HDBLCM)  (Issue# 69)

cd /hana/shared/HDB/HDB02/vhcalhdbdb
rm .daemon.ini.swp

vi daemon.ini
Edit section [localsecurestore] to change instances = 0

STEP 4: REGISTER DATABASE 

The HANA DB hdblcm register_rename_system command will rename the filesystem for you according to the new target SID for Hana database instance. HDB => HDD.

Please ensure groupid=1000 is free and groupid=79 are free. Use SAP Note 3686516 for troubleshooting.

Execute HANA database specific steps as below:

sid-hdd-s4d: ##/hana/shared/HDB/hdblcm/hdblcm --action=register_rename_system  --groupid=1000 --lss_groupid=79

TIP: Places where you need to enter data is indicated, rest all are default options. Please note hdblcm now includes rename database host and a separate step with command to rename db host (hdblcm --action=rename_system --hostmap=vhcalhdbdb=vhcalhdddb) is not required. Also a separate step to rename mount points (hdblcm --action=register_rename_system) is not required.

This should bring up the database processes as below

sid-hdd-s4d: #/usr/sap/hostctrl/exe/sapcontrol -nr 02 -function GetProcessList

TIP: At this point it is necessary to install the HANA database license as the database will be started in restricted mode.

STEP 5: EXTRACT SWPM Extract SWPM in folder /install. Use the SAPCAR already available to extract.

sid-hdd-s4d:/install #/sapmnt/S4D/exe/uc/linuxx86_64/SAPCAR -xvf /sapmedia/SWPM20SP22_5-80003424.SAR

STEP 6: RENAME SAP SYSTEM Rename instance using sapinst

sid-hdd-s4d:/install # ./sapinst SAPINST_ENFORCE_CRL=false SAPINST_USE_HOSTNAME=vhcals4dci SAPINST_GUI_HOSTNAME=vhcals4dci 

Copy below URL into chrome browser to start sapinst rename process:

https://sid-hdd-s4d.dummy.nodomain:4237/sapinst/docs/index.html

In SAPINST select System Rename => Standard System => SAP System Rename

At screen SAP System Parameters enter Source System S4H and Target System S4D:
Click on Next.

At the screen Prerequisite Checker Results accept or fix the Prerequisite check results.
Click on Next. No if you don't want to repeat the test

At the screen SAP Instance Parameters accept or change the Target System Instance Numbers.
Click on Next.

At the screen SAP HANA Database Connectivity enter Instance Number 02(or changed number) and Password Appliance__1234. Click on Next.

If you don't install HANA DB license you will get error below. Install license using HANA Studio and continue. License is required if there is a database SID change..

At the screen SAP HANA Database Parameter you can change Schema User , DBACOCKPIT and SYSTEM password. Please note it is also optional to change the schema user SAPHANADB password along with DBACOCKPIT and SYSTEM users.

At the screen Database Schema accept schema SAPHANADB password and confirm Schema password Xxxxxxxn click on Next.

At the screen Rename Tenant Database click on Next

At the screen Secure Storage for Database Connection select HANA Secure User tore (hdbuserstore) click on Next 

At the screen Operating System Users accept master password or enter password Xxxxxxxn
At the screen Secure Storage Key Generation accept radio button ‚Äì Individual Key (Recommended for Productive Systems) On the Next
At next screen Warning click OK
At the screen DNS Domain Name checkmark Set FQDN for SAP System and enter domain name dummy.nodomain Click on Next
At the screen Install License Key keep unchecked Install License Key. Click on Next
TIP: It is much easier to install the license by providing the file than doing it later through the application.
At next screen Cleanup of Encryption Key checkmark on Yes cleanup os users and click on Next
At next screen Cleanup of Operating System Users checkmark on Yes cleanup os users and click on Next
Here is the Parameter Summary Click on Next to confirm and begin the installation.

TIP: In case you get this ERROR:

(1) Error occurs when executing command 'changekey' using the command line tool 'rsecssfx'.

RESOLUTION: Follow SAP Note 2800204 - SSFX-0362: Value file "-" does not start with the UTF-8 byte order mark

Ensure the environment variable LC_CTYPE of the user running sapinst is set as LC_CTYPE=en_US.
Stop the current sapinst and restart it. Continue with the existing option.

(2) You may get Warning below for rename of profile parameter. Found possible references to the source system in the profile directory of the target system /sapmnt/S4D/profile 

After sapinst process is finished you can manually start the SAP instance S4D

sid-hdd-s4d:/install # /usr/sap/hostctrl/exe/sapcontrol -nr 01 -function StartSystem ALL
sid-hdd-s4d:/install # /usr/sap/hostctrl/exe/sapcontrol -nr 00 -function StartSystem ALL

After instance is started and confirmed you can delete the sapmedia folder and remove temporary links to S4H as well as temporary hostnames.

Standard users are as follows:
HANA DB ‚Äì Instance 02 SYSTEM /<Master Password> or as you changed in above
Web Dispatcher access : bpinst/Welcome1

STEP 7: POST STEPS Follow steps from guide attached to SAP Note 2041140 - First Steps for on-premise installations.pdf => Section 5 Technical Post-deployment Activities

Adapt HANA connections in DBACOCKPIT (nothing was required to be done here).

Host name / port in table HTTPURLLOC using tcode httpurlloc

Adapt RFC Connections

ABAP connections:
‚Ä¢ LOCAL_RFC
‚Ä¢ S4DCLNT100, S4DCLNT200, S4DCLNT400
‚Ä¢ S4D_RFC

HTTP connections:
‚Ä¢ ADS (pointing to the JAVA server after PART3: INSTALL SAP NW JAVA /ADS)
‚Ä¢ LOCAL_HTTP
‚Ä¢ LOCAL_HTTPS
‚Ä¢ S4FIN_HTTPS

SAP Enable Now Web Assistant enter tCode /UI2/FLP_CUS_CONF

Adapt the Fiori notification URL. enter tCode /UI2/FLP_SYS_CONF

Adapt Enterprise Search

Apply product license keys

Install software product license key: Technical restrictions may apply if you don‚Äôt install the license. Use the link to obtain license key.
HANA DB license key can be installed via HANA Studio (Preferences -> License)
In SAP S/4HANA 1909 the license key is installed via SAP logon tCode SLICENSE

Further post-installation checks

Install SAP client tools on your local computers

You can take a full backup and remove the temporary links that were setup for S4H

In client 000 fix transport configuration. Enter tCode SE06 and reinstall CTS transport system, Change originals to S4D, Delete old TMS config, delete old versions of transport routes

Adapt any SAP parameters due to changed SID

The database should be with log mode overwrite and you may like to change that as needed.Please carry out the the other basis steps that are usually done with SID change/System refresh :

SPAD - Spool Administration
SCC4 - Client Administration - Logical System
RZ10- Instance profiles
SP01 - Spool delete old spool requests

PART3: INSTALL SAP NW JAVA / ADS

STEP 1: PREPARE SYSTEM Prepare Linux Server as below for the appliance. The values in Used column below show the minimum size needed. Total filesystem needed is min 70GB for installation.

Plan the change of SID, hostname, instance number. Please refer to the notes below for reserved SIDs SAP Note 1979280 ‚Äì Reserved SAP System Identifiers (SAPSID) with Software Provisioning Manager and hostnames SAP Note 611361 ‚Äì Hostnames of SAP ABAP Platform servers

The table below shows standard SID and hostnames and what we are changing it to.

The /etc/hostname and /etc/host file is below:

STEP 2: EXTRACT FILES

Extract files 51059242_5.ZIP  in /sapmedia

sid-j2d:/sapmedia# unzip 51059242_5.ZIP

We will install Java instance from files in  /sapmedia/51059242_5/SAPNetWeaver750SP32ASJAVAwithAdobeDocumentServices

cd /sapmedia/51059242_5/SAPNetWeaver750SP32ASJAVAwithAdobeDocumentServices

In the next step we will extract the above *.tgz files but please note the directories size is as follows so you can provide ample space:

These files will be extracted under /sapmnt/J2E; /usr/sap/J2E and /sybase/J2E. After these are extracted you can rename the filesystem or remount with changed mount points.

sid-j2d:/sapmedia# cat dblog.tgz-*  | tar -zpxvf - -C /
sid-j2d:/sapmedia# cat dbexe.tgz-*  | tar -zpxvf - -C /
sid-j2d:/sapmedia# cat dbdata.tgz-* | tar -zpxvf - -C /
sid-j2d:/sapmedia# cat sapmnt_j2e.tgz-* | tar -zpxvf - -C /
sid-j2d:/sapmedia# cat usrsap_j2e.tgz-* | tar -zpxvf - -C /

STEP 3: GET PASSWORDS Download the file below and open the file in Internet Explorer to note passwords:
/sapmedia/51059242_5/SAPNetWeaver750SP32ASJAVAwithAdobeDocumentServices/SAP_Software_Appliance.xml

STEP 4: RENAME MOUNT POINTS You can take a full OS backup at this point and rename mount points or directories to /sybase/J2D; /sapmnt/J2D; /usr/sap/J2D. The old standard mount points do not have to exist. After reboot ensure all new renamed mount points are valid.

STEP 5 EXTRACT SWPM Extract SWPM in folder /install. Use the SAPCAR already available to extract.

sid-j2d:/install #/sapmnt/J2D/exe/uc/linuxx86_64/SAPCAR -xvf /sapmedia/SWPM10SP45_2-20009701.SAR

STEP 6 RENAME SAP SYSTEM Rename instance using sapinst

sid-j2d:/install # ./sapinst SAPINST_USE_HOSTNAME=vhcalj2dci 

Copy below URL into chrome browser to start sapinst rename process:

https://sid-j2d.dummy.nodomain:4237/sapinst/docs/index.html

In SAPINST select System Rename => Standard System => SAP System Rename

At the screen Software Integrity click on Next

At screen SAP System Parameters enter Source System J2E and Target System J2D:
Click on Next.

At the screen Prerequisite Checker Results accept or fix the Prerequisite check results.
Click on Next. No if you don't want to repeat the test

At the screen SAP Instance Parameters accept or change the Target System Instance Numbers.
Click on Next.

At the screen Database System Type keep the default selection SAP Adaptive Server Enterprise for Business Suite

At the screen Operating System Users accept master password or enter password Xxxxxxxn

At the screen Operating System User for SAP Database Administrator enter the password for sybj2d and User ID and Click on Next

At the screen SAP ASE Database System Parameters accept or change ports and Click on Next

At the screen Database User Passwords enter the passwords for user sa, sapsa, sapsso, SAPSR3DB which is Welcome_2Welcome_2. Click on Next

At the screen DNS Domain Name checkmark Set FQDN for SAP System and enter domain name dummy.nodomain Click on Next

At the screen Media Browser select the media Package Location and Click on Next

At next screen Cleanup of Operating System Users checkmark on Yes cleanup os users and click on Next

Here is the Parameter Summary Click on Next to confirm and begin the installation.

After about 10mins, the installation process will stop at this point.

You may get Warning below for rename of profile parameter. Found possible references to the source system in the profile directory of the target system /sapmnt/J2D/profile 

Please take note and proceed.

After the sapinst installation is complete, you can manually start/stop the SAP Java instance J2D using old startsap / stopsap commands

sid-j2d:/install # su - j2dadm
sid-j2d:j2dadm > startsap

To access JAVA server as SAP Netweaver Administrator the URL is:
https://sid-j2d.dummy.nodomain:50000/nwa

Standard users are as follows:
JAVA Administrator ‚Äì Adminitstrator / <Master Password> ;
Java user BPINST/Welcome1

STEP 7: POST STEPS Follow steps from guide attached to SAP Note 2041140 - First Steps for on-premise installations.pdf - Section 5 Technical Post-deployment Activities

Apply product license keys if you haven't installed during swpm install step before. Technical restrictions may apply if you don‚Äôt install the license. Use the link to obtain license key. SAPNetweaver 7.5 J2EE license key has to be installed via SAP Netweaver Administrator

Further post-installation checks
Adapt any SAP parameters due to changed SID
After instance is started and confirmed you can delete the sapmedia folder.

SUPPORT TICKETS:

If you have any difficulty downloading the media open OSS message using component XX-SER-SAPSMP-SWC. If you have issues with technical deployment open message with component BC-INS-SRN.

OTHER REFERENCES:

SAP S/4HANA Fully-Activated Appliance: Create your SAP S/4HANA system in a fraction of the usual setup time
SAP S/4HANA Fully-Activated Appliance: Demo Guides

Blogs with known issues (2022 / 2021 / 2020), continuously updated

2041140 - Order an SAP pre-assembled Best Practices software appliance (as partner or customer)

Thank you. Hope you enjoyed the installation.

Mahesh Sardesai
Product Expert ‚Äì S/4HANA

entry.title: Best Practice for Managing Business Role Changes After an Upgrade
entry.content:
Dear community,

what is in your opinion the best way to manage the changes after an upgrade in consideration of transports of software collections?

At the moment it seems for me, you have to maintain the changes two times with a 3 landscape system:

1. Update the business roles in Test system to make the changes available for testing the release

2. Update the business roles in Q system again after the release was deploy to Q and Productive System to transport the changes with the software collection to all 3 systems

Is this the correct procedure? Is there a better way which I am missing?

thank you for your inputs, 

kind regards

Regina

entry.title: Purchase order accruals POAC and periodic billing plan
entry.content:
Dear members,

My company is using improperly partial invoicing plan instead of periodic invoicing (as a consequence the standard reports to show the overdue items are not working because the status of the items of a partial invicoing are only recalculated and updated when open the PO in change mode). So we would like to switch periodic invoicing plan.

However while doing some test i found that the purchase accruals calculated are incorrect because they are not at item level :

Let's say I have a PO line for 1200 USD from January to December with a monthly billing plan of 100,  delivery date is mandatory so for example I put 31/12. If I run my POAC in March I would be  expecting an accrual of 300. However as the delivery date of the whole line is not reached there is no accrual. In contrary if I set a delivery date on 28/02, then the accrual is 100% of the line so 1200.

And as we are using service materials, it not possible to have several deliveries.

So my question is : is there a way to calculate the accruals based on the dates of the items of the periodic invoicing plan and not the delivery date ?

Thank you for your help

entry.title: La strat√©gie SAP Business Network pour l‚Äôavenir de la facturation √©lectronique
entry.content:
De nombreux gouvernements dans le monde r√©alisent peu √† peu les avantages qu‚Äôoffre la num√©risation, notamment la rapidit√©, la transparence et, particuli√®rement en mati√®re de facturation, l'am√©lioration du contr√¥le fiscal. Les entreprises du monde entier voient donc un nombre croissant de pays introduire des portails de facturation √©lectronique ou fiscaux, associ√©s √† des obligations de conformit√©. Les processus de facturation traversent un changement fondamental √† l‚Äô√©chelle mondiale qui ne peut √™tre ignor√©, et la conformit√© devient le principal argument des organisations lorsqu'elles choisissent un prestataire de transformation digitale.

 

Que signifie une obligation d‚Äôe-facturation?

Chaque pays avance √† sa propre vitesse, au fur et √† mesure de leur progr√®s dans la digitalisation de leurs services et de l‚Äôautorit√© fiscale. La facturation par l'interm√©diaire d'un portail gouvernemental est par exemple une r√©alit√© depuis pr√®s de deux d√©cennies au Br√©sil, et l'Europe conna√Æt le m√™me changement depuis quelques ann√©es, avec l'introduction de SDI en Italie, de NAV en Hongrie, ou de PEPPOL pour le secteur public dans l'ensemble de l'UE. Ces portails devenant ainsi progressivement une partie obligatoire du processus de facturation. Une obligation d‚Äôe-facturation peut donc signifier de nombreuses choses diff√©rentes: une norme de format, un reporting obligatoire des factures sur un portail gouvernemental, voire un processus enti√®rement int√©gr√© d'approbation des factures et d'interop√©rabilit√© entre syst√®mes.
En r√©sum√©, la facturation est devenue plus complexe, en particulier pour les soci√©t√©s op√©rant dans plusieurs r√©gions, pays ou juridictions. Notre coll√®gue Christoph Neumann aborde certains de ces sc√©narios dans un r√©cent webinaire, pr√©sent√© en anglais.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Une complexit√© suppl√©mentaire pour les entreprises

Afin de r√©pondre aux exigences de conformit√© r√©glementaire, les entreprises doivent rester au fait des r√©glementations en constante √©volution et s'int√©grer aux portails ou r√©seaux des administrations locales, ce qui rend souvent leur solution actuelle de facturation √©lectronique redondante. Pour un fournisseur, il peut devenir fastidieux de recevoir des bons de commande dans un portail choisi, mais de facturer sur le portail impos√© par le gouvernement. Cela est inefficace et compromet la valeur de r√©seaux professionnels tels que SAP Business Network.

 

Notre strat√©gie pour l'avenir

Sur base d'un dialogue constant avec nos clients, nous avons √©tabli une vision et une strat√©gie, que nous avons pr√©sent√©es dans un article pr√©c√©dent et qui se r√©sume comme suit :

Au-del√† de la conformit√© r√©glementaire, SAP Business Network vise √† rationaliser la collaboration interentreprises, en transformant la mani√®re dont les soci√©t√©s travaillent avec leurs partenaires commerciaux et les autorit√©s fiscales du monde entier, √† l'aide d'applications SAP et partenaires.

Pour concr√©tiser cette vision, quatre innovations majeures sont pr√©vues pour fa√ßonner le d√©veloppement futur de SAP Business Network :
Tout d'abord, nous allons devenir un r√©seau ouvert en offrant aux fournisseurs un point d'acc√®s unique pour la facturation sortante afin d'envoyer des factures conformes √† la loi √† l‚Äôensemble de leurs clients, qu‚Äôils soient ou non sur SAP Business Network.
Deuxi√®mement, nous voulons am√©liorer la gestion des litiges li√©s aux factures gr√¢ce √† des workflows int√©gr√©s et optimis√©s par l'IA pour r√©duire les efforts manuels et offrir une r√©solution plus rapide, dans l'int√©r√™t des acheteurs et des fournisseurs.
Ensuite, nous am√©liorerons la visibilit√© du statut des factures gr√¢ce au perfectionnement des codes d‚Äôerreur et motifs de rejet. Il s'agit l√† d'un probl√®me r√©current pour les fournisseurs.
Enfin, nous pr√©voyons de r√©tablir les validations des exigences client pour les acheteurs (¬´ Business rules ¬ª), ce qui permet l‚Äôenvoi de factures conformes aux attentes du client.

√Ä l'avenir, les fournisseurs pourront donc utiliser SAP Business Network en tant que prestataire unique pour atteindre tous leurs clients, avec l'assurance que toutes les complexit√©s nationales et les exigences de facturation sont prises en charge. La r√©duction des litiges li√©s aux factures et l'am√©lioration de la visibilit√© sur les erreurs ou les motifs de rejet offriront une exp√©rience de facturation √©lectronique fluide et un canal de communication unique pour les fournisseurs et leurs clients.

 

La conformit√© croissante de SAP Business Network

Chez SAP, la conformit√© n'est que le d√©but. Nous avons toujours suivi les √©volutions des mandats fiscaux et de facturation et fait le n√©cessaire pour rester conformes. Ainsi, le r√©seau est d√©j√† conforme dans les pays qui exigent actuellement l'utilisation d'un portail gouvernemental ou o√π certaines particularit√©s s'appliquent.

Plus important encore, SAP Business Network offre une valeur ajout√©e au-del√† de la simple conformit√© r√©glementaire : les fournisseurs peuvent compter sur ses nombreuses fonctionnalit√©s intuitives et robustes pour automatiser, optimiser et d√©velopper leur activit√© commerciale. Pour n'en nommer que quelques-unes :

  • une offre flexible adapt√©e √† vos besoins avec deux types de compte et un abonnement, 
  • une interface intuitive et un principe de facturation PO-flip efficace, 
  • la visibilit√© sur le statut des factures et une messagerie instantan√©e pour une communication fluide avec les clients, 
  • la cr√©ation d‚Äôun profil commercial complet avec des informations sur la conformit√© et la durabilit√©, 
  • des catalogues √©lectroniques publics et priv√©s pour promouvoir les produits et services, 
  • des outils de reporting et d‚Äôanalyse de performance uniques, mis en contexte avec le reste de l‚Äôindustrie, afin de fournir les donn√©es n√©cessaires aux conversations strat√©giques, 
  • des opportunit√©s de croissance via la d√©couverte de nouveaux acheteurs.

La combinaison unique de ces fonctionnalit√©s et de l'engagement envers notre strat√©gie fait de SAP Business Network la solution de choix pour toutes les entreprises √† la recherche d'une valeur strat√©gique au-del√† des simples transactions.

Pour plus d'informations, vous trouverez ici notre strat√©gie d√©taill√©e sur la facturation √©lectronique (en anglais).

 

Continuez √† vous informer en vous abonnant au terme SAP Business Network for Suppliers, en cliquant simplement sur le bouton bleu en haut de cette page.

Vous recherchez plus de contenu pour les fournisseurs SAP Business Network? Visitez notre page d√©di√©e!

entry.title: My experience with Joule for Consultants PoC
entry.content:
Joule for Consultants; sentiments after a few weeks.

Key words: SAP; Joule; Joule for Consultants;

Introduction:

I was one of the lucky ones to join the Joule for Consultants (J4C) Proof of Concept. I have been using this product for quite a few months, and I would like to share my findings. Most of all I am quite positive.

Having a technical and development background I was very curious about where J4C could support me, knowing that there‚Äôs a Joule for Developers as well (and even free to use).

On a side note: this article is fully written by a human, even though it writes about the use of AI. The only em-dash you‚Äôll find is in this sentence, and it‚Äôs right here: ‚Äú‚Äî‚Äù.

What is Joule for Consultants (J4C).

According to SAP marketing, it is a silver bullet: ‚ÄúSAP Joule for Consultants accelerates SAP projects and cloud transformations with the most authoritative AI assistance grounded in exclusive SAP knowledge. It enables consultants to increase productivity with fast and reliable answers, minimize rework with expert-level guidance that improves every design decision, and deliver more operational efficiency by ensuring projects align with best practices.‚Äù There is a more descriptive landing page with a more concise description: ‚ÄúSAP Joule for Consultants is a conversational AI solution that accelerates SAP cloud transformations with expert guidance from SAP‚Äôs most exclusive and up-to-date knowledge base.‚Äù. You can even find a course on the learning hub.

Or, in my own words, Joule for Consultants is a chat based AI solution that lets you quickly search in SAP documentation, coding, OSS notes and knowledge base.

How did I use J4C?

If you start J4C, you get a prompt, stating ‚ÄúMessage Joule‚Ä¶‚Äù. Straightforward and effective, in the style of other popular LLM AI‚Äôs.

There are a few shortcuts to help you in your way:

For example, the ‚ÄúQuick Links‚Äù, give examples of effective and less effective prompts. I like to read these quite often, as it helps in giving a more useful result.

And after this, the real journey starts. Let‚Äôs give a real-life example.

I was asked to maintain and change a few forms in SD, so I started with the question: ‚ÄúWhat are the best practices in SAP S/4HANA, private edition, for configuring forms for different types of sales documents?‚Äù. I found the result quite impressive. It shows an overview of sales documents, followed by best practices, technical configuration, document specific configuration, integration considerations, testing, common pitfalls and maintenance. It took input from the SAP Learning hub, the SAP OSS Notes, the online documentation and the SAP Community pages, combining it in one useful, comprehensive format.

This was a good introduction, but I was searching for a specific form. In hindsight, my question was not specific enough, so I asked for details: ‚ÄúGive me an example on how in customizing I can couple a document type to a specific form‚Äù.  A quite extensive list follows, including the customizing path, different transactions like NACE, VOV8 etc. It also refers to output types, condition tables and access sequences. Again, several related topics like troubleshooting, testing and best practices are included.

With this, I can almost start, but my client has a complex setup. So, I would like to know more about conditions records: ‚ÄúExplain how to maintain and test condition records for Output Determination in detail with examples.‚Äù

And voila, I have exactly what I need to start. This saved me several hours of digging or questioning my functional counterpart.

I tried the same questions in LeChat (Mistral), ChatGPT and Claude. Claude and LeChat show reasonable to good answers, although they are obviously missing the link to OSS notes. ChatGPT suggests SAPscript and SmartForms, next to Adobe Forms. Asking for more details about customizing or condition records yields answers, but all three of them have hallucinations when it comes to transactions, paths or Fiori maintenance apps. Especially ChatGPT is going in a different direction: it starts explaining BRF+.

Is Joule for Consultants always so spot on? Alas, no. Once you get in to more specialized functionality, like the dateline functionality in purchasing (sometimes used in the Retail and Fashion Management suite), it looks like J4C is missing relevant sources and documentation. It starts nice, but when asking for advice on enhancing the datelines J4C starts to hallucinate with non-existing or obsolete BAdI‚Äôs.

I also noticed that J4C oftentimes mixes input from sources describing Public Cloud solutions with Private Cloud solutions. This leads to confusing answers, but it still saves me a lot of time.

Development

Although it is called Joule for Consultants, as a developer I wanted to see the capabilities of judging (ABAP) source code. I specifically used ABAP, as the competitors mentioned earlier are good with JavaScript solutions. I uploaded a not very well-designed ABAP program (using an ALV) and used the predefined question:

The first result was OK-ish, but I was a bit disappointed after the previous results. So I asked Joule to elaborate: ‚ÄúGive me advice on how to improve the design of the program‚Äù. And oh my, this was good: I got a list of aspects where to improve:

  1. Architecture & Structure Improvements
  2. Error Handling & Robustness
  3. Performance Optimizations
  4. Code Quality Enhancements
  5. Modern ABAP Features
  6. Transaction Management
  7. User Experience Improvements
  8. Security & Authorization
  9. Testing & Maintainability
  10. Suggested Refactored Structure

This was way more than expected, and a lot more detailed. Again, the other LLM-AI‚Äôs are not that good with ABAP, but Joule 4C is impressive. Especially, digging deeper with questions like ‚ÄúGive me examples of Implementing dependency injection‚Äù and ‚ÄúExplain the pros and cons of each suggestion‚Äù gives understandable and valuable responses focused on ABAP development.

Conclusion

Overall, I am satisfied with J4C. It saves me a lot of time. The answers are always in context of SAP, and mostly up to date. This is a plus compared to the more open standard LLM AI‚Äôs, who mix in a lot of old ECC answers. J4C is not perfect yet, especially in less-used areas of SAP‚Äôs functionality, or when it mixes private (and on-premise) vs public cloud answers .

entry.title: Re: Which SQL tools can use associations of CDS views?
entry.content:
Hello Andreas,

the user of the Custom CDS Views app itself does not need/have S_DEVELOP authorization. To be able to use the app, you have to have either the "Analytics Specialist" or the "Extensibility Specialist" role. See https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/#/detail/Apps('F1866A').

In ADT, the SQL console you mentioned is the right choice. The DB itself does not know associations as such.

Other Fiori tools to explore the VDM are the "View Browser" as well as the "Customer Data Browser", but you can't follow or model associations there.

To get more accurate answers from the experts, you might want to add some more details about your role (why no development authorization), the system (private or public cloud) and what exactly you want to achieve.

Best Regards
Andreas

entry.title: Filling the gab between BW and Datasphere (a bit): Implementing a few standard variables
entry.content:
• Introduction
  • How to install:
  • How were they implemented:
  • Example: Analytical Models
  • Implemented Variables
  • 0CALDAY: Calendar Day
  • 0CALMONTH: Calendar Year / Month
  • 0CALQUARTER:
  • 0CALWEEK:
  • 0CALYEAR:

Introduction

Welcome to the first blog in a series where I'll try my best to close up some of the functionality gabs between the old SAP BW system and  SAP Datasphere.
With the end of life for the old SAP BW systems in sight, companies and developers have been diving deep into SAP Datasphere, to build new, exciting solutions, in addition to migrating existing reports. 

Personally, I've been involved with several Datasphere implementations now, and one thing I have found myself missing a lot was the standard Exit variables for things like "Current month", "Current year" and so on. 

To make my life, and hopefully yours as well, I've recreated a set of the old date / calendar variables.
All the views are bundled in a nice package, which you can download from this GitHub repo. 

How to install:

Note: Your Datasphere tenant does not need to be connected to the Content Network for this to work. 

One the package is installed, you may, or may not, need to change the source of the view 2VR_CALENDER_WRAPPER, which is the basis of all the other views. 
This was simply done to make sure that even if your space does not contain the Time Objects, you only have to remap 1 object. 

  1. Go to this GitHub Repo and download the package
  2. Go to your Datasphere tenant and select "Import":
  3. Click Upload and select the package downloaded in step 1.
  4. After the import is complete click the package:
  5. Under "Import Options", map the space:

     

  6. And click "Import". 
  7. (Certain cases): If the view "SAP.TIME.VIEW_DIMENSION_DAY" is not present in the target space open the view 2VR_CALENDER_WRAPPER and replace the source.

 

How were they implemented:

All the views are implemented as SQL views, and only return a single column, depending on the kind of view, rather than an interval, which some SAP BW variables might give. The reason for that is explained in the example below. 

All views have an input parameter, IP_OFFSET, which takes an integer, and will offset the result by one "unit" of time. 
So the CALYEAR views will offset one year at a time, the month views will offset one month at the time, and so on. 

Example: Analytical Models

In Datasphere, an Analytical Model is the final (kind of, that's not important now) step in the data modelling process. 
In your analytical model, you can define different kind of variables, that allows you to derive a value from a view, or a dynamic default. 
Note:  Deriving select options and intervals are not supported. 

In the above example, the user will be prompted to fill in an interval, but will only derive the first value:

If you want an interval, you'll need "Multiple single values".

In the above example, we've provided a view that returns three values, which will act as an interval.
Note: We have also provided the value -1 for the offset.

Which means all the values, 202601, 202512, 202511, and 202510 is offset by -1:

Implemented Variables

I've created variables for the following date objects:

  • 0CALDAY: Date (YYYYMMDD)
  • 0CALMONTH: Cal. Year / Month (YYYYMM)
  • 0CALQUARTER: Cal. Year / Quarter (YYYYQ)
  • 0CALWEEK: Cal. Year / Week (YYYYWW)
  • 0CALYEAR: Calendar Year (YYYY)

Because - well, because those were the ones that had been giving me headaches.

0CALDAY: Calendar Day 

View IDSAP BW Variable IDDescription
2VR_0DATE0DATE

Current Calendar Day

2VR_0CEPO_CDPDCY0CEPO_CDPDCY

Last Day

2VR_0CEIO_CDL7CDCY0CEIO_CDL7CDCY

Last 7 Days

2VR_0CEIO_CDL14CDCY0CEIO_CDL14CDCY

Last 14 Days

2VR_0CXIO_CDCMCY0CXIO_CDCMCY

All days in current Month

2VR_0CXIO_CDCQCY0CXIO_CDCQCY

All days in current quarter

2VR_0CXIM_CDFYCY0CXIM_CDFYCY

All days in current year

2VR_0CXIM_CDFYPY0CXIM_CDFYPY

All days in last year

0CALMONTH: Calendar Year / Month

View IDSAP BW Variable IDDescription
2VR_0CXPO_CMPMPY0CXPO_CMPMPY

Last Cal. Year / Month previous year

2VR_0CXPO_CMCMPY0CXPO_CMCMPY

Current Cal. Year / Month previous year

2VR_0CXIO_CMPQPY0CXIO_CMPQPY

Last Quarter Previous Year

2VR_0CXIO_CMPQCY0CXIO_CMPQCY

Last Quarter

2VR_0CXIO_CML12PMCY0CXIO_CML12PMCY

Last 12 Cal. Year / Months excluding Current

2VR_0CXIO_CML12CMCY0CXIO_CML12CMCY

Last 12 Cal. Year / Months Including Current

2VR_0CXIO_CMCQPY0CXIO_CMCQPY

Current Quarter Previous Year

2VR_0CXIO_CMCQCY0CXIO_CMCQCY

Current Quarter

2VR_0CMONTH0CMONTH

Current Cal. Year / Month

2VR_0CEPO_CMPMCY0CEPO_CMPMCY

Last Cal. Year / Month

2VR_0CEIO_CML6CMCY0CEIO_CML6CMCY

Last 6 Cal. Year / Months Including Current

2VR_0CEIO_CML3CMCY0CEIO_CML3CMCY

Last 3 Cal. Year / Months Including Current

0CALQUARTER:

View IDSAP BW Variable IDDescription
 
2VR_0CXPO_CQQ1CY		0CXPO_CQQ1CY
First Quarter of Current Year
 
2VR_0CXPO_CQCQPY		0CXPO_CQCQPY
 Current Quarter of Previous Year
 
2VR_0CQUART		0CQUART
 Current Quarter

0CALWEEK:

View IDSAP BW Variable IDDescription
2VR_0CWEEK0CWEEK
Current calendar week

0CALYEAR:

View IDSAP BW Variable IDDescription
2VR_0PYEAR0PYEARLast calendar year

entry.title: CX_DBA_PARSE_ERROR in DBACOCKPIT Dump History - ASE 16.0.04.07 on SAP Kernel 754
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I am encountering a dump in DBACOCKPIT when trying to access Backup and Recovery -> Database Dump History.

Error Details:

  • Exception: CX_DBA_PARSE_ERROR

  • Class: CL_SYB_DBMS_UTILS

  • Method: CAST_FMT_TSTAMP_TO_DB6TSTAMP

  • Message: Unable to parse date/time.

System Environment:

  • SAP Kernel: 754 Patch 628 (64-bit Unicode)

  • DB Client Library: Sybase ASE 16.0.04.07

  • OS: SLES 15

What I have checked so far:

  1. OS Locales: The environment variables for sidadm and sybsid are set to en_US.UTF-8.

     

  2. https://me.sap.com/notes/2780872/E: I found this Note which describes the exact issue, but it only references older SAP Notes (for Basis 7.40) and does not provide specific correction instructions for Basis 754.

  3. Note 1558958: This collection note also seems to target older releases.

It seems like the ABAP parser cannot handle the date/time format returned by the ASE 16.0.04.07 engine.

Does anyone know the specific Correction Collection Note for SAP_BASIS 754 that addresses this timestamp parsing issue? Or is there a specific DB parameter/locale setting within ASE that could force a compatible date format?

Thanks in advance for your help!

entry.title: LGM Knowledge Snippet: The idea behind Normalized Quantities
entry.content:
How do you compare 100 pieces of Product A with 50 boxes of Product B? How do you know when you've consolidated enough cargo to fill a truck? This is where Normalized Quantities come into play in SAP Logistics Management - a concept designed to represent estimated pallet footprints for meaningful consolidation decisions.

The Pallet Footprint Problem

In transportation planning, the key question is: "How much truck space does this cargo need?" The answer isn't in pieces, boxes, or kilograms - it's in how many pallet positions the cargo occupies on the truck floor.

Think about it: A truck driver doesn't care if you have 1,000 units or 10,000 units. They care about: "How many pallet spots does this take up on my truck?"

That's exactly what normalized quantities represent in LGM: the pallet footprint of your cargo.

The Geographic Challenge: Not All Pallets Are Equal

Here's where it gets interesting. When we say "pallet footprint," which pallet are we talking about?

Euro-Pallet vs. US Pallet: A Real World Problem

In Europe, one of the most common standard for pallets is the Euro-pallet:

  • Dimensions: 1200mm √ó 800mm (0.96 m¬≤)
  • Standard truck capacity: 20-24 Euro-pallet positions
  • used Unit of Measure Code: EPA (for the example here, this is not a delivered content)

In the United States, it's the US pallet:

  • Dimensions: 48" √ó 40" (1.94 m¬≤ - double the Euro-pallet!)
  • Standard 53-foot trailer: 26-28 US pallet positions
  • used Unit of Measure Code: UPA (for the example here, this is not a delivered content)

Let's say you're shipping 1,200 units of Product X from two different warehouses:

Frankfurt Warehouse:
  • Product X: 120 units fit on 1 Euro-pallet
  • Normalized quantity: 1,200 √∑ 120 = 10 EPA
  • Truck capacity used: 10/24 = ~42% of a European truck
Chicago Warehouse:
  • Product X: 280 units fit on 1 US pallet (larger footprint!)
  • Normalized quantity: 1,200 √∑ 280 = 4.3 UPA
  • Truck capacity used: 4.3/26 = ~17% of an American truck

Same product, same quantity, but completely different truck capacity requirements. This is why normalized quantities must be geography-specific - they represent actual physical footprint on region-specific trucks.

The key insight: Normalized quantities represent the regional standard pallet format for measuring truck/container capacity.

How SAP Logistics Management Implements This

Step 1: Determine the Regional Pallet Standard

When a Transportation Request is created, a business rule(NORMALIZED_UNIT_OF_MEASURE_DETERMINATION) determines which pallet format represents capacity for that geography:

IF Shipping Point DE01 ‚Üí Normalized UoM = 'EPA' (Euro-pallet positions) IFShipping Point US02  ‚Üí Normalized UoM = 'UPA' (US pallet positions) 

Step 2: Convert Everything to Pallet Equivalents

The system converts each item to pallet positions using product-specific conversion factors:

  • "200 pieces of Product A = 1 EPA position"
  • "4 cartons of Product B = 1 EPA position"
  • "2 boxes of Product C = 0.5 EPA position"

Step 3: Aggregate for Truck Capacity Decisions

All items are summed to show total pallet positions needed:

  • Transportation Request level: Sum of all item pallet positions
  • Consignment level: Sum of all assigned Transportation Requests

This aggregated number directly answers: "How many pallet positions do I need on the truck?"

On a note: At the moment we only do this aggregation if the normalized quantity can be determined for all items. This might become configurable in future.

Practical Example: Hamburg Distribution Center

You're consolidating LTL shipments from Hamburg. Your consolidation rule: "Ship when you reach 15 EPA pallet positions OR 12:00 noon, whichever comes first."

Throughout the morning, different products arrive:

Time Product Original Quantity Pallet Positions
9:00 AMIndustrial components480 pieces2.4 EPA
9:30 AMPackaged goods12 cartons3.0 EPA
10:15 AMBulk items84 boxes4.2 EPA
11:00 AMPre-palletized goods6 Euro-pallets6.0 EPA

Total: 15.6 EPA pallet positions ‚úÖ

The system triggers consolidation cutoff. You know exactly what you need: a truck with ~16 pallet positions, which is perfect for a standard European LTL carrier (they typically quote 15-20 pallet bands).

Behind the scenes, you're shipping "480 pieces + 12 cartons + 84 boxes + 6 pallets" - an impossible mental calculation. But normalized to pallet positions, it's clear: 15.6 EPA pallet spots.

Why This Matters

The normalized quantity concept solves several critical problems:

  1. Consolidation Decisions: "Do I have enough cargo?" translates to "Do I have enough pallet positions?"This helps e.g. to determine the correct processing variant ( the respective input parameter is planned to be added for the processing variant determination)
  2. Carrier Determination: The best carrier can depend on the number of pallets you expect to ship.
  3. Carrier Communication: German carriers expect "15 EPA pallet positions." US carriers expect "5 UPA pallet positions." The system speaks their language.

Closing Thoughts

Normalized quantities translate the complex world of mixed products, different units of measure, and varied packaging into one simple question: "How many pallet positions does this cargo occupy?"

By using region-specific pallet standards (EPA in Frankfurt, UPA in Chicago, AUS in Sydney), LGM ensures that consolidation decisions reflect actual truck capacity requirements in each market.

The next time you see "15.6 EPA" on a consignment, remember: that's not just a number - it's telling you that you need 15-16 Euro-pallet positions on a European truck. It's the difference between guessing truck capacity and knowing exactly what you need.

And if you're wondering why 1,200 units converts to 10 pallets in Europe but only 4.3 pallets in the US? Now you know - a US pallet has literally double the footprint of a Euro-pallet, so fewer are needed to represent the same cargo.

Feel free to leave comments if you have questions about how normalized quantities work in your specific scenarios!

entry.title: Reference field in Cloud for Credit Integration - Manage Credit Reports
entry.content:
Hello,

we are facing an issue with the Reference Field in the ‚ÄúManage Credit Reports‚Äù app in SAP S/4HANA Cloud for credit integration (Foundry) 

Normally, when we order a credit report, the Reference Field is automatically populated with the Business Partner ID. After the credit report is received, the Reference Field in the Manage Credit Reports app remains populated, and we can also see which user ordered the report.

However, when Business Partner Monitoring is active, the Reference Field is not populated when a credit report is updated. In addition, the Creator is shown as anonymous. Unfortunately, our business department relies on this information to quickly identify the relevant Business Partner when reviewing the Manage Credit Reports app.

After discussing this with our credit agency, we learned that they are not able to populate the Reference Field on their side.

Do you have any suggestions on how the Reference Field could be populated in this scenario?
Is there, for example, a way to enhance or inject custom logic so that the Reference Field in Cloud for Credit Integration is populated (e.g. based on the Company Name or Business Partner)?

Thank you !

entry.title: S/4HANA 2025 FPS0 Fully-Activated Appliance standard installation
entry.content:
This blog covers installation of (1) SAP S/4HANA server and (2) SAP NW JAVA / ADS server as shown in the graphic below. The installation is based on file restore and is different from the standard installs using SWPM.

Please refer to S/4HANA SQUARE ONE for other blogs

In this blog the procedure is simplified for hostname change and SID change. Also if you want to change instance number the command, screens show where you can change the instance number. This would make sense if your network cannot accommodate the unique hostname and SID. Also if it is a more permanent installation you may like to change SID and hostname.

If you want to do standard installation with no change in hostname and sid please refer to other blog In this blog the procedure is simplified for standard installation with NO HOSTNAME OR SID CHANGE. The advantage with this is that you don't have to do many of the steps related to SID change and it does make sense if you will be installing the instance temporarily.

This blog is based on a fresh installation of SUSE Linux for SAP OS without having any previous SAP instances created and deleted. I did not have to pre install hostagent, etc. There are mount points/links to be setup as shown in the right place in the directory structure. The steps in the guides provided with SAP Note 2041140 could be used as a reference in case there are issues specific to your environment. Just follow the steps below to install both systems shown in red square below:

Please find below the main note for ordering the appliance:
2041140 - Order an SAP pre-assembled Best Practices software appliance (as partner or customer)

PART1: SOFTWARE DOWNLOAD

Please download the software media from https://me.sap.com/softwarecenter
INSTALLATIONS & UPGRADES => By Alphabetical Index (A-Z) => S => SAP S/4HANA => SAP S/4HANA 2025 => S/4HANA FULLY-ACTIVATED APPLIANCE => SAP S/4HANA 2025 FA APPL

On SAP S/4HANA Server, download the 51059242_1 to 51059242_5  files and SWPM20SP22_5-80003424.SAR (or later).

On SAP NW JAVA / ADS server, download the 51059242_5, SWPM10SP45_4-20009701.SAR and 51050829_JAVA_part 1 & 2 - NW 7.5 Java based SW Comp.

PART2: INSTALL SAP S/4HANA

STEP 1: PREPARE SYSTEM Prepare Linux Server as below for the appliance. The values in Used column below show the minimum size needed. For /sapmnt provide min 30GB, /hana/data space - min 500GB, /hana/log min 120GB. I have used /sapmedia - 200GB temporary separate mount that can be removed later.

TIP: The /sapmedia filesystem could be external mount. To save this space, the files could be downloaded to /hana/data/HDB and deleted as they are being extracted. In this case it would be good to extract dbdata files first.

The /etc/hostname and /etc/host file is below:

STEP 2: EXTRACT FILES Extract files 51059242_*  in /sapmedia

sid-hdb-s4h:/sapmedia# unzip 51059242_1.ZIP
sid-hdb-s4h:/sapmedia# unzip 51059242_2.ZIP
sid-hdb-s4h:/sapmedia# unzip 51059242_3.ZIP
sid-hdb-s4h:/sapmedia# unzip 51059242_4.ZIP
sid-hdb-s4h:/sapmedia# unzip 51059242_5.ZIP

Allow approx 2 hours for extraction.

We will install Central system with DB and App on same server. Please move all *.tgz-* files (from 51059242_1 to 51059242_4) to /sapmedia/51059242_1/SAPS4HANA2025SAPHANADB20_1

cd /sapmedia/51059242_1/SAPS4HANA2025SAPHANADB20_1
mv /sapmedia/51059242_2/SAPS4HANA2025SAPHANADB20_2/*.tgz-*   .
mv /sapmedia/51059242_3/SAPS4HANA2025SAPHANADB20_3/*.tgz-*   .
mv /sapmedia/51059242_4/SAPS4HANA2025SAPHANADB20_4/*.tgz-*   .
mv /sapmedia/51059242_5/SAPS4HANA2025SAPHANADB20_5/*.tgz-*   .

In the next step we will extract the above *.tgz files but please note the directories size is as follows so you can provide ample space:

Please use command below to extract the database related archives:

sid-hdb-s4h:/sapmedia/# cd 51059242_1/SAPS4HANA2025SAPHANADB20_1

cat dblog.tgz-* | tar --numeric-owner -zpxvf - -C /

Similarly extract the remaining files:

cat dbexe.tgz-* | tar --numeric-owner -zpxvf - -C /
cat dbdata.tgz-* | tar --numeric-owner -zpxvf - -C /

It takes about an hour for extraction.

Below two Application related archives may be extracted on a separate app server for distributed installation. These files will be extracted under /sapmnt/S4H and /usr/sap/S4H

Then extract the files:
sid-hdb-s4h:/usr/sap #cd 51059242_1/SAPS4HANA2025SAPHANADB20_1
cat usrsap_s4h.tgz-* | tar --numeric-owner  -zpxvf - -C /
cat sapmnt_s4h.tgz-* | tar --numeric-owner  -zpxvf - -C /

STEP 3: GET PASSWORDS  
Download the file below and open the file in Internet Explorer to note passwords:
/sapmedia/51059242_1/SAPS4HANA2025SAPHANADB20_5/SAP_Software_Appliance.xml


Follow this procedure as it is a known issue, please refer SAP Note 2082466 - Known Issues in SAP HANA Platform Lifecycle Management (HDBLCM)  (Issue# 69)

cd /hana/shared/HDB/HDB02/vhcalhdbdb
rm .daemon.ini.swp

vi daemon.ini
Edit section [localsecurestore] to change instances = 0

STEP 4: REGISTER DATABASE 

Please ensure groupid=1000 is free and groupid=79 are free. Use SAP Note 3686516 for troubleshooting.

Execute HANA database specific steps as below:

sid-hdb-s4h: ##/hana/shared/HDB/hdblcm/hdblcm --action=register_rename_system  --groupid=1000 --lss_groupid=79

This should bring up the database processes as below

sid-hdb-s4h: #/usr/sap/hostctrl/exe/sapcontrol -nr 02 -function GetProcessList

STEP 5: EXTRACT SWPM Extract SWPM in folder /install. Use the SAPCAR already available to extract.

sid-hdb-s4h:/install #/sapmnt/S4H/exe/uc/linuxx86_64/SAPCAR -xvf /sapmedia/SWPM20SP22_5-80003424.SAR

STEP 6: RENAME SAP SYSTEM Rename instance using sapinst, although we want to keep SID same as standard - S4H we need to run the procedure so that the process installs the missing items.

sid-hdb-s4h:/install # ./sapinst SAPINST_ENFORCE_CRL=false SAPINST_USE_HOSTNAME=vhcals4hci SAPINST_GUI_HOSTNAME=vhcals4hci 

Copy below URL into chrome browser to start sapinst rename process:

https://sid-hdb-s4h.dummy.nodomain:4237/sapinst/docs/index.html

In SAPINST select System Rename => Standard System => SAP System Rename

You get screen below:

At above screen SAP System Parameters enter Source System S4H and Target System S4H:
Click on Next.

At the screen Prerequisite Checker Results accept or fix the Prerequisite check results.
Click on Next. No if you don't want to repeat the test

At the screen SAP Instance Parameters accept or change the Target System Instance Numbers.
Click on Next.

At the screen SAP HANA Database Connectivity enter Instance Number 02 and Password Welcome_2Welocme_2. Click on Next.

At the screen SAP HANA Database Parameter you can change Schema User , DBACOCKPIT and SYSTEM password. Please note it is also optional to change the schema user SAPHANADB password along with DBACOCKPIT and SYSTEM users.

At the screen Database Schema accept schema SAPHANADB password and confirm Schema password Xxxxxxxn click on Next.

At the screen Rename Tenant Database click on Next

At the screen Secure Storage for Database Connection select HANA Secure User tore (hdbuserstore) click on Next

At the screen Operating System Users accept master password or enter password Xxxxxxxn

At the screen Secure Storage Key Generation accept radio button ‚Äì Individual Key (Recommended for Productive Systems) On the Next

At next screen Warning click OK

At the screen DNS Domain Name checkmark Set FQDN for SAP System and enter domain name dummy.nodomain Click on Next

At the above screen Keep Existing Licenses accept unchecked of Keep existing licenses. Click on Next

At the screen Install License Key keep unchecked Install License Key. Click on Next

TIP: It is much easier to install the license by providing the file than doing it later through the application.
At next screen Cleanup of Encryption key checkmark on Yes cleanup os users and click on Next
Here is the Parameter Summary Click on Next to confirm and begin the installation.

TIP: In case you get this ERROR:

(1) Error occurs when executing command 'changekey' using the command line tool 'rsecssfx'.

RESOLUTION: Follow SAP Note 2800204 - SSFX-0362: Value file "-" does not start with the UTF-8 byte order mark

Ensure the environment variable LC_CTYPE of the user running sapinst is set as LC_CTYPE=en_US.
Stop the current sapinst and restart it. Continue with the existing option.

sid-hdb-s4h:/install # /usr/sap/hostctrl/exe/sapcontrol -nr 01 -function StartSystem ALL
sid-hdb-s4h:/install # /usr/sap/hostctrl/exe/sapcontrol -nr 00 -function StartSystem ALL

After instance is started and confirmed you can delete the sapmedia folder and remove temporary links to S4H.

Standard users are as follows:
HANA DB ‚Äì Instance 02 SYSTEM /<Master Password> or as you changed in above
Web Dispatcher access : bpinst/Welcome1

STEP 7: Follow steps from guide attached to SAP Note 2041140 - First Steps for on-premise installations.pdf => Section 5 Technical Post-deployment Activities

Adapt HANA connections in DBACOCKPIT

Host name / port in table HTTPURLLOC

Adapt RFC Connections if needed

ABAP connections:
‚Ä¢ LOCAL_RFC
‚Ä¢ S4HCLNT100 (and other clients)
‚Ä¢ S4H_RFC

HTTP connections:
‚Ä¢ ADS (pointing to the JAVA server after PART3: INSTALL SAP NW JAVA /ADS)
‚Ä¢ LOCAL_HTTP
‚Ä¢ LOCAL_HTTPS
‚Ä¢ S4FIN_HTTPS

SAP Enable Now Web Assistant

Adapt the Fiori notification URL

Adapt Enterprise Search

Apply product license keys

Install software product license key: Technical restrictions may apply if you don‚Äôt install the license. Use the link to obtain license key.
HANA DB license key can be installed via HANA Studio (Preferences -> License)
From SAP S/4HANA 1909 onwards the license key is installed via SAP logon tCode SLICENSE

Further post-installation checks

Install SAP client tools on your local computers

You can take a full backup and remove the temporary links that were setup for S4H

In client 000 fix transport configuration. Enter tCode SE06 and reinstall CTS transport system.

Adapt any SAP parameters required

The database is provided with log mode overwrite and you may like to change that as needed.

PART3: INSTALL SAP NW JAVA / ADS

STEP 1: Prepare Linux Server as below for the appliance. The values in Used column below show the minimum size needed. Total filesystem needed is min 70GB for installation.

The /etc/hostname and /etc/host file is below:

STEP 2: Extract files 51059242_5.ZIP  in /sapmedia

sid-j2e:/sapmedia# unzip 51059242_5.ZIP

We will install Java instance from files in  /sapmedia/51059242_5/SAPNetWeaver750SP32ASJAVAwithAdobeDocumentServices

cd /sapmedia/51059242_5/SAPNetWeaver750SP32ASJAVAwithAdobeDocumentServices

In the next step we will extract the above *.tgz files but please note the directories size is as follows so you can provide ample space:

These files will be extracted under /sapmnt/J2E

sid-j2e:/sapmedia# cat dblog.tgz-* | tar -zpxvf - -C /
sid-j2e:/sapmedia# cat dbexe.tgz-* | tar -zpxvf - -C /
sid-j2e:/sapmedia# cat dbdata.tgz-* | tar -zpxvf - -C /
sid-j2e:/sapmedia# cat sapmnt_j2e.tgz-* | tar -zpxvf - -C /
sid-j2e:/sapmedia# cat usrsap_j2e.tgz-* | tar -zpxvf - -C /

STEP 3: Download the file below and open the file in Internet Explorer to note passwords:
/sapmedia/51059242_5/SAPNetWeaver750SP32ASJAVAwithAdobeDocumentServices/SAP_Software_Appliance.xml

STEP 4: Extract SWPM in folder /install. Use the SAPCAR already available to extract.

sid-j2e:/install #/sapmnt/J2E/exe/uc/linuxx86_64/SAPCAR -xvf /sapmedia/SWPM10SP45_2-20009701.SAR

STEP 5: Rename instance using sapinst

sid-j2e:/install # ./sapinst SAPINST_ENFORCE_CRL=false SAPINST_USE_HOSTNAME=vhcalj2eci SAPINST_SLP_MODE=false

Copy below URL into chrome browser to start sapinst rename process:

https://sid-j2e.dummy.nodomain:4237/sapinst/docs/index.html

In SAPINST select System Rename => Standard System => SAP System Rename

At the screen Software Integrity click on Next

At screen SAP System Parameters enter Source System J2E
Click on Next.

At the screen Prerequisite Checker Results accept or fix the Prerequisite check results.
Click on Next. No if you don't want to repeat the test

At the screen SAP Instance Parameters accept or change the Target System Instance Numbers.
Click on Next.

At the screen Database System Type keep the default selection SAP Adaptive Server Enterprise for Business Suite

At the screen Operating System Users accept master password or enter password Xxxxxxxn

At the screen Operating System User for SAP Database Administrator enter the password for sybj2e and User ID and Click on Next

At the screen SAP ASE Database System Parameters accept or change ports and Click on Next

At the screen Database User Passwords enter the passwords for user sa, sapsa, sapsso, SAPSR3DB which is Welcome_2Welcome_2. Click on Next

At the screen DNS Domain Name checkmark Set FQDN for SAP System and enter domain name dummy.nodomain Click on Next
At the screen Install License Key keep unchecked Install License Key. Click on Next

TIP: It is much easier to install the license by providing the file than doing it later through the application.

At next screen Cleanup of Operating System Users checkmark on Yes cleanup os users and click on Next

Here is the Parameter Summary Click on Next to confirm and begin the installation.

 

You can manually start/stop the SAP Java instance J2E using old commands

sid-j2e:/install # su - j2eadm
sid-j2e:j2eadm > startsap

To access JAVA server as SAP Netweaver Administrator the URL is:
https://sid-j2e.dummy.nodomain:50000/nwa

Standard users are as follows:

JAVA Administrator ‚Äì Administrator / <Master Password> ;
Java user BPINST/Welcome2Welcome2

STEP 6: Follow steps from guide attached to SAP Note 2041140 - First Steps for on-premise installations.pdf - Section 5 Technical Post-deployment Activities

Apply product license keys if you haven't installed during swpm install step before. Technical restrictions may apply if you don‚Äôt install the license. Use the link to obtain license key. SAPNetweaver 7.5 J2EE license key has to be installed via SAP Netweaver Administrator

Further post-installation checks

Adapt any SAP parameters due to changed SID

After instance is started and confirmed you can delete the sapmedia folder.

SUPPORT TICKETS:

If you have any difficulty downloading the media open OSS message using component XX-SER-SAPSMP-SWC. If you have issues with technical deployment open message with component BC-INS-SRN.

OTHER REFERENCES:

SAP S/4HANA Fully-Activated Appliance: Create your SAP S/4HANA system in a fraction of the usual setup time
SAP S/4HANA Fully-Activated Appliance: Demo Guides

Blogs with known issues (2022 / 2021 / 2020), continuously updated

2041140 - Order an SAP pre-assembled Best Practices software appliance (as partner or customer)

Thank you. Hope you enjoyed the installation.

Mahesh Sardesai
Product Expert ‚Äì S/4HANA

entry.title: Create Purchasing Contract with conditions via API Purchase Contracts (Version 2)
entry.content:
Hello SAP,

We are trying to create purchasing contracts with conditions, i.e., entities:

  • A_PurContrItmCndnAmountType (Item Condition Amount)
  • A_PurContrItmCndnScalesType (Item Condition Scales)
  • A_PurContrItmCndnValdtyType (Item COndition Validity)

However, the interface Purchase Contracts (Version 2) / API_PURCHASECONTRACT_PROCESS_SRV;v=2 provided for this purpose does not seem to support conditions during initial creation. Unfortunately, we cannot find any meaningful documentation and are therefore wondering whether this is generally not technically possible or what method we need to use to create purchasing contracts with conditions in SAP.

It is important to note that these conditions should be different from those created in the purchasing info record. In other words, from a technical/business perspective, we are getting even better purchasing conditions in the purchasing contract than in the purchasing info record.

In short: How can purchasing contracts with conditions from another external system be created

entry.title: Re: UKM_CASE: rejected document still has the status "blo...
entry.content:
Yes, rejected entries still carry the ‚ÄúBlocked‚Äù overall status ‚Äî that‚Äôs standard system behavior. To hide them, you either need to use query variants/filters or implement a custom enhancement that sets a separate status for rejected cases.

SAP recommends using Decision Codes (Release, Reject, etc.) to distinguish the outcome of blocked documents. For operational users, provide query variants or custom reports that filter out rejected cases. If the business needs a hard separation, a small enhancement to set a distinct overall status for rejected documents is the cleanest way.

entry.title: Re: Item-level discounts and XML mapping in S/4HANA Cloud...
entry.content:
Dear customer, 

From a Document Reporting Compliance -eDocuments perspective, this is the standard and expected behavior in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition for Colombia. The XML generation supports the explicit representation of discounts that are managed at header level, which are reflected as Allowances in the electronic document.

Best regards, 

Liliana Cruz

entry.title: Re: LMS External instructor marking attendance
entry.content:
Hi @DriesMoerman ,

The most possible reason based on both of these options missing is that the Class has a cost associated to it, meaning the Purchasing Option on the Class is set to anything but 'No Charge'.

You can validate this on the Class entity > Purchasing tab > Purchasing option (if it says 'Inherit Item Chargeback Settings', then check the value for the same in the next section of this page and it will let you know what is the Purchasing Option inherited from the parent item.

Instructors are by design restricted from adding walk-ins to classes if the class has a cost associated.

This is explained in the following KBA: 2281678 - No option to "Add Users" on Past Classes for instructor 

Marking completions is also not possible by default if the class has any other purchasing option beyond 'No Charge', unless you actually enable the related configuration:

System Administration > Configuration > System Configuration > FINANCE > enableRecordCompletionInInstructorViewWithFinance > set to 'true' if you would like to allow Instructors to record completions on classes with a financial purchase.

Configuration property explanation: 

# This configuration allows the addition of learning history (Record Completion) from the Instructor View when a class's purchasing options are something other than No Charge. This includes purchasing options: Distribute Charges to Specified Account Code, Charge to Buyer's Authorized Account Code, or Charge to Buyer's Specified Account Code.
# Default configuration is false. Only classes with purchasing option of No Charge will support record completion.

I hope this explanation was helpful and answered your question.

Best regards,
Enik≈ë

entry.title: Re: ENABLING STRUCTURED PROGRAM IN LMS
entry.content:
Hi @Rajamannar,

This specific configuration option is not available in SuccessFactors Learning, however, you can build a program structure by creating Agendas for the Program and you can control the user's progress with the Progress Restriction settings.

Please find the following resources for further information:

Help Portal | Creating Agendas for Learning Programs
Help Portal | Learning Programs Basic Settings

entry.title: Re: Create Purchasing Contract with conditions via API Pu...
entry.content:
Below are the limitations and considerations

  • No direct POST for conditions: You cannot create conditions in one payload with the contract.
  • Maintenance overhead: Conditions must be added separately, either manually or via extensibility.
  • Audit/compliance: SAP deliberately restricts condition creation via API to avoid uncontrolled pricing changes.
  • Best practice: Use contracts for quantity/validity control and info records for pricing; only override conditions in contracts when necessary.

For your ask on documentation, you can check in the below areas

Purchase Contracts (Version 2) 

Here, you‚Äôll see POST/PATCH operations only for A_PurchaseContractType and A_PurchaseContractItemType. Condition entities are visible in the model but not in the operations list.
